channel.title: Python Coding
channel.description:
Hey if anyone knows Python (v. 3) I'd be grateful if you helped me out with my small program. The lines I marked with a ++++ gets a syntax error when I run the code.
[code=python]#Guess My Name Game
#Sets your guesses to 0 out of 6 guessesTaken = 0
#Talks to player, input = typing print('Hello, what is your name?') playerName = input()
#Talks to player more, playerName = input print('Nice to meet you ' + playerName + ', I would like you to guess my name!') print('I will give you a hint: it starts with a n.') print('DO NOT USE CAPITALS.')
#Gives myName the string 'nick' myName = nick #Adds 1 out of 6 guesses on every try guessesTaken = guessesTaken + 1
#If the guesses taken are less then 6 you can try again while guessesTaken < 6: print('Take a guess!') guess = int(guess)
#Each time the guess number increases they get a new hint if guessesTaken == 2 ++++ print('Nope, that is not my name. I will give you a 2nd hint. The next letter is "i".')
if guessesTaken == 3 ++++ print('Nice try, but no that is not my name. The 3rd hint is it rhymes with thick.')
if guessesTaken == 4 ++++ print('No that is not it. This is your last hint: The third letter is "c".')
if guessesTaken == 5 ++++ print('Nope, you have 1 more guess!')
#Stops the loop if they guess my name if guess == myName break
#If player guesses 'nick', then they win if guess = myName print('Congratulations, you guessed my name!')
#6th try ends it, this gives my name if guess != myName: myName = str(myName) print('No, you did horrible! My name is ' + myName) [/code]

item.title: Python Coding
item.dc:creator: @_bool
item.description:
@_bool wrote:

for the first two statements you have 8 spaces then for the if statement directly succeeding it you have 4 spaces.

in python indentation is how the interpreter decides code scope since you don’t use brackets like in most other languages.

Read full topic

item.title: Python Coding
item.dc:creator: @Just_Lurkin Just Lurkin
item.description:
@Just_Lurkin wrote:

Hey if anyone knows Python (v. 3) I’d be grateful if you helped me out with my small program.
The lines I marked with a ++++ gets a syntax error when I run the code.

[code=python]#Guess My Name Game

#Sets your guesses to 0 out of 6
guessesTaken = 0

#Talks to player, input = typing
print(‘Hello, what is your name?’)
playerName = input()

#Talks to player more, playerName = input
print('Nice to meet you ’ + playerName + ‘, I would like you to guess my name!’)
print(‘I will give you a hint: it starts with a n.’)
print(‘DO NOT USE CAPITALS.’)

#Gives myName the string ‘nick’
myName = nick
#Adds 1 out of 6 guesses on every try
guessesTaken = guessesTaken + 1

#If the guesses taken are less then 6 you can try again
while guessesTaken < 6:
print(‘Take a guess!’)
guess = int(guess)

#Each time the guess number increases they get a new hint
if guessesTaken == 2 ++++
print(‘Nope, that is not my name. I will give you a 2nd hint. The next letter is “i”.’)

if guessesTaken == 3 ++++
    print('Nice try, but no that is not my name. The 3rd hint is it rhymes with thick.')

if guessesTaken == 4 ++++
    print('No that is not it. This is your last hint: The third letter is "c".')

if guessesTaken == 5 ++++
    print('Nope, you have 1 more guess!')

#Stops the loop if they guess my name
if guess == myName
break

#If player guesses ‘nick’, then they win
if guess = myName
print(‘Congratulations, you guessed my name!’)

#6th try ends it, this gives my name
if guess != myName:
myName = str(myName)
print('No, you did horrible! My name is ’ + myName)
[/code]

Read full topic
